availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Mark Wallace (Mason County, Kentucky, pvt , qmster sgt, 1st lieut 40th KY Inf USA)

body.p: Mason County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Susan Wallace. Resident of Mason County in 1850. Served in the 40th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private, quartermaster sergeant, and first lieutenant from August 1863 to October 22, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, East Maysville, p. 119A-B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 435.
